intro: Chaetogastra multiflora, commonly known as the multibract bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, tubular flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. The plant has a sprawling growth habit and produces numerous small, hairy leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely known outside of its native range.
